title: Logistics Executive Job at Me Cure Industries Limited
content:
Me Cure Industries Limited strives to provide innovative healthcare solutions to our clients. We convert the promise of modern day technology and expert care into the services that have the power to restore health and save lives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Executive

Job Location: Lagos

Role Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Responsible for the end-to-end logistics operations for our shipment with various stakeholders, including customs authorities, freight forwarders, and internal teams, to facilitate smooth operations while ensuring that shipments are handled efficiently, compliant with regulations and delivered in a timely manner.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Optimize transportation routes and distribution networks in collaboration with internal departments and external partners.
	Ensure adherence to industry regulations and standards, including Good Distribution Practice (GDP) and Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP).
	Implement changes to operations to maintain compliance with up-to-date regulations.
	Oversee handling and transportation of products to meet quality assurance standards.
	Prepare and submit documentation for customs clearance, including invoices, shipping manifests, and certificates of origin.
	Ensure compliance with local and international customs regulations and standards.
	Maintain accurate records of clearing and forwarding activities for audit and reference.
	Track product movements and ensure accurate record-keeping.
	Negotiate contracts and monitor performance to meet service level agreements (SLAs).
	Collaborate with freight forwarders, shipping lines, and other logistics providers for efficient operations.
	Coordinate the transportation of goods from origin to destination, including arranging shipping, handling, and warehousing.
	Track and monitor shipments to ensure timely delivery and address logistical challenges.
	Address and resolve logistics-related issues such as delays, damages, and discrepancies.
	Communicate with suppliers, customers, and internal teams to provide updates and resolve shipment-related concerns.
	Identify and address problems related to customs, forwarding, or logistics effectively.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candiates should send their Applications to: hr@mecure.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Senior Accountant Job at DGIC International Business Services Limited
content:
DGIC International Business Services Limited is the business unit of the Delegation of German Industry and Commerce in Nigeria (known as AHK Nigeria). DGIC International Business Services Ltd facilitates bilateral trade and investment relations between Nigeria and Germany. It is the contact point for all German companies that wish to establish business relations in Nigeria and vice-versa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Accountant

Job Location: Lagos (Hybrid)
Job Schedule: Full-time
Start Date: 01 July 2025

Role Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As a Senior Accountant, you will play a key role in supporting the Finance and Administration Department by ensuring the accuracy and integrity of financial information.
	Your obligation will include preparing financial reports, performing account reconciliations, maintaining the general ledger and assisting in the preparation of tax returns.
	You will also contribute to audit readiness and execution, while taking on various accounting duties as assigned to support overall departmental goals and compliance requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Report directly to the Head of Finance, while also collaborating closely with the General Manager and Director.
	Perform accurate and timely bookkeeping & data entry to maintain up-to-date financial records.
	Support the preparation of monthly and quarterly financial reports for both local and international stakeholders.
	Assist in the development of budgets and the preparation of ad hoc financial reports as required.
	Manage invoicing for ongoing projects and generate revenue reports to support financial tracking.
	Aid in the preparation and submission of tax filings and ensure compliance with statutory requirements.
	Contribute to the development and continuous improvement of processes within the Finance and Administration Department.
	Monitor and manage credit to ensure healthy cash flow and minimize financial risk.
	Coordinate with external auditors and tax consultants to facilitate annual audits and tax filings.
	Ensure all financial practices comply with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), and specific guidelines from DHIK.
	Perform additional duties as assigned, in alignment with the scope of the role and Organizational needs.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in accounting, Banking and Finance, Economics, or a related field.
	A minimum of 2-3 years of experience in Accounting.
	Excellent knowledge of MS Office, particularly with Excel.
	Relevant Accounting Certifications such as ACCA, CFA, ACA, ICAN (is an added advantage).
	Proficiency in Accounting software e.g. QuickBooks and Sage.
	Excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills.
	Exceptional verbal and written communication abilities, coupled with strong interpersonal skills.
	Proficient in conducting in-depth financial analysis to support strategic decision-making.


What We Offer


	Competitive compensation.
	Health insurance & retirement plan.
	Flexible working hours (up to 3 days of remote work per week).
	Opportunities for professional development.
	Dynamic international team environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume, a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience, interest in the role and salary expectations and copies of their Academic and Professional credentials to: hr@lagos-ahk.de using “Application for the role of Senior Accountant" as the subject of the email.

title: Accountant Job at Glyde Lubricants Limited
content:
Glyde Lubricants is one of the fastest-growing independent lubricants producers in Nigeria. We are endowed with highly motivated and enthusiastic professionals driven by a vision to excel in the production of quality products and services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant 

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Finance Manager will be responsible for overseeing the financial health of the company.
	This includes planning, analysis, controls, compliance, and reporting.
	The ideal candidate is not just good with numbers but can design scalable finance systems, guide budgeting, manage risk, and support management with actionable insights.
	This role requires hands-on execution and strategic thinking in equal measure.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Planning & Analysis:


	Develop and manage budgets, forecasts, and financial models.
	Conduct monthly variance analysis and prepare management reports.
	Provide strategic recommendations to support business decisions, expansion, and cost-saving.


Cash Flow & Treasury Management:


	Monitor daily cash flow and manage bank relationships.
	Oversee accounts payable, receivable, and working capital.
	Ensure optimal liquidity and proper allocation of resources.


Accounting & Bookkeeping Oversight:


	Supervise accurate bookkeeping, general ledger, and financial statements.
	Review reconciliations, journals, and month-end/year-end close processes.
	Ensure accounting records comply with regulatory and internal standards.
	Liaise with external auditors, tax consultants, and regulatory agencies.
	Implement internal controls and risk management procedures to protect company assets.


Costing & Profitability Management:


	Work closely with production and operations teams to track product costings.
	Monitor COGS, profit margins, and cost efficiency across departments.
	Support pricing decisions with accurate financial data.


Team Leadership & Collaboration:


	Supervise junior accountants and finance officers.
	Collaborate with HR, sales, logistics, and operations on cross-functional initiatives.
	Drive adoption of digital tools and ERP systems where relevant.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree or higher in Finance or related field 5 - 7 years of relevant experience
	Fluency in the Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
	Detailed Oriented and highly analytical
	ICAN, ACCA, or other professional certification (fully or partly qualified).
	MBA or additional finance certification is an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: nnekaezeasor9@gmail.com cc: isioma.ighodalo@glydelubricants.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
